alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:32AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Jefferson County through 315 AM CDT... At 231 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Reynolds, or 5 miles southwest of Fairbury, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Endicott around 240 AM CDT. Fairbury around 250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jansen and Plymouth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
